verses.text: 耶和華留下的民族這些國的人是耶和華留下的，為要藉著他們來試驗以色列人，就是所有沒有經驗過迦南任何戰爭的人；

words.note: 過 indicates past experience.

verses.text: 好使以色列人的後代，那些以前沒有經驗過這些戰爭的人，知道學習爭戰。

words.note: 過 indicates past experience.

verses.text: 他留下的就是非利士人的五個首領，和所有迦南人、西頓人，以及住在黎巴嫩山上的希未人，從巴力．黑門山直到哈馬口。

words.note: 口 (kǒu) means 'mouth' but can refer to a pass or entrance.

verses.text: 他們留在那裡，為要藉著他們試驗以色列人，要知道他們是否聽從耶和華藉摩西吩咐他們列祖的誡命。

words.definition: to want to, to need to

words.note: Primarily used in religious contexts for divine commands.

verses.text: 以色列人就住在迦南人、赫人、亞摩利人、比利洗人、希未人、耶布斯人中間；
他們娶他們的女兒作妻子，也把自己的女兒嫁給他們的兒子，並且事奉他們的神。

words.note: Introduces object before verb
To serve or worship a deity or superior.
Often capitalized as 'God' for the one true God.

verses.text: 俄陀聶以色列人行了耶和華看為惡的事，忘記了耶和華他們的 神，去事奉眾巴力和亞舍拉。

words.note: The Hebrew name for God.
The Hebrew name for God.
An ideographic space, often used for reverence before 'God' in Christian texts.
Often capitalized as 'God' for the one true God.
To serve or worship a deity or superior.
Often precedes plural groups or deities.
Refers to various Canaanite fertility gods.
Refers to Canaanite goddesses or their cultic poles/images.

verses.text: 因此，耶和華的怒氣向以色列人發作，把他們完全交在兩河之間的亞蘭王古珊．利薩田的手中；以色列人服事了古珊．利薩田八年。

words.note: The Hebrew name for God.
Refers to anger erupting or breaking out.
Introduces object before verb
Lit. 'between two rivers'.
Aram was an ancient region in Syria.
Here implies servitude or being oppressed.

verses.text: 以色列人向耶和華哀求的時候，耶和華就為以色列人興起一位拯救者拯救他們，就是迦勒的弟弟基納斯的兒子俄陀聶。

words.note: The Hebrew name for God.
The Hebrew name for God.
Respectful measure word for people.

verses.text: 耶和華的靈臨到他身上，他就治理以色列人；他出去作戰，耶和華把亞蘭王古珊．利薩田交在他手中，他的能力就勝過了古珊．利薩田。

words.note: The Hebrew name for God.
Often refers to the Spirit of God or the Holy Spirit.
The Hebrew name for God.
Introduces object before verb
Aram was an ancient region in Syria.

verses.text: 於是國中太平了四十年。後來基納斯的兒子俄陀聶死了。
以笏以色列人又行了耶和華看為惡的事，耶和華就使摩押王伊磯倫強盛起來，欺壓以色列人，因為他們行了耶和華看為惡的事。

words.note: Appears as a chapter or section heading here.
Often refers to moral evil in scripture.
Often refers to moral evil in scripture.

verses.text: 伊磯倫集合了亞捫人和亞瑪力人，前來擊敗了以色列人，佔領了棕樹城。

words.note: Refers to Jericho in ancient times.

verses.text: 於是以色列人服事了摩押王伊磯倫十八年。
以色列人向耶和華哀求的時候，耶和華就為他們興起一位拯救者，就是便雅憫人基拉的兒子以笏，是一個用左手的人。以色列人派他把貢物送給摩押王伊磯倫。

words.note: Used respectfully for people.
Lit. 'saving person'.

verses.text: 以笏做了一把兩刃的劍，長半公尺，縛在右腿上，在衣服底下。

words.note: Refers to both sides of a blade being sharp.

verses.text: 他把貢物呈獻給摩押王伊磯倫；伊磯倫原是個非常肥胖的人。

words.note: Indicates direct object is acted upon.
Lit. 'not common'.

verses.text: 以笏獻完了貢物，就把抬貢物的眾人打發走了。

words.note: Indicates direct object is acted upon.

verses.text: 自己卻從靠近吉甲的眾雕像那裡回來，說：「王啊，我有一件機密的事要對你說。」王說：「暫不要說。」侍立左右的人都離開他出去了。

words.note: Often refers to court attendants.
Lit. 'left and right', meaning people on either side.

verses.text: 以笏來到王那裡；王獨自一人坐在涼樓上。以笏說：「我有 神的話要告訴你。」王就從座位上站起來。

words.note: An elevated room designed to catch breezes for coolness.
Traditional Chinese Bible convention to indicate reverence for God's name.
Often capitalized or preceded by a reverential space in Chinese Bibles.
Indicates movement away from a surface.

verses.text: 以笏就伸出左手，從右腿上拔出劍來，刺入王的腹中；

words.note: Positional particle
Directional complement indicating movement towards the speaker
More formal/biblical than 肚子裡

verses.text: 連劍柄與劍身都刺進去了，肥肉把劍身夾住，因此他沒有把劍從王的肚腹裡拔出來；接著他就從窗戶爬了出去。

words.note: Formal equivalent of 和
Indicates completion and movement away from the speaker/subject
More formal/biblical than 肚子
Locational noun, often used as suffix

verses.text: 以笏出到走廊，把涼樓上的門關起來，上了鎖。

words.note: Refers to a specific type of upper room, often for privacy or coolness
Positional particle
Here means 'to apply' or 'to put on'
Functions as object of the verb 上

verses.text: 以笏出來以後，王的僕人才來到；他們看見涼樓上的門鎖著，就說：「王一定是在涼樓上大解。」

words.note: Common word, but frequent in biblical context
Refers to a specific type of upper room, often for privacy or coolness
Positional particle
Indicates a continuous state of being locked
Refers to a specific type of upper room, often for privacy or coolness
Positional particle
Archaic euphemism for defecation

verses.text: 他們等到發慌了，見他還不打開涼樓的門，就拿鑰匙來開；不料，看見他們的主人早已倒在地上死了。

words.note: Literary equivalent of 看見
Refers to a specific type of upper room, often for privacy or coolness
Indicates purpose or direction towards speaker

verses.text: 他們耽延的時候，以笏已經逃跑了；他經過眾雕像那裡，逃到西伊拉去。

words.note: Refers to idols or graven images in biblical context.

verses.text: 他去到以後，就在以法蓮山地吹角；以色列人與他一同從山地上下來，他走在他們前頭，
對他們說：「你們跟隨我，因為耶和華已經把你們的仇敵摩押人交在你們手中。」他們就跟隨他下去，攻取約旦河的渡口，攔截摩押人，不讓一個過去。
那時他們擊殺了約有一萬摩押人，都是強壯的、勇猛的人，沒有一人逃脫。
這樣，從那天起，摩押就在以色列人的手下被制伏了，於是國中太平了八十年。

words.note: Often implies military or political subjugation.

verses.text: 珊迦以笏之後，有亞拿的兒子珊迦；他用趕牛棒擊殺了六百非利士人；他也拯救了以色列人。

words.note: A pole used to prod oxen, sometimes with a sharpened end.
A people group from ancient Canaan.
Often used in religious contexts for spiritual salvation.
The descendants of Jacob, God's chosen people.
